DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study test efficacy repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) cognitive improvement individual mild cognitive impairment ( MCI ) . The main objective study investigate ability rTMS produce cognitive improvement individual MCI . A secondary objective determine whether individual MCI follow mild brain trauma respond differently rTMS treatment compare individual non-trauma related MCI . All participant undergo active sham ( placebo ) rTMS treatment . Cognitive psychological assessment administer week rTMS therapy , active sham condition . Cognitive test include verbal , semantic , logic , visual , conceptual , memory task .
DOC.brief_title: Magnetic Brain Stimulation Treatment Mild Cognitive Impairment
DOC.detailed_description: This open-label pilot study test efficacy repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) cognitive improvement individual mild cognitive impairment ( MCI ) . 16 patient trauma-related MCI 16 patient non-trauma-related MCI recruit . All patient undergo one week active rTMS stimulation one week sham stimulation , separate least one week . Each treatment week consist five consecutive daily stimulation session . The order active versus sham treatment session counterbalance across subject within group ( i.e. , half subject group receive active stimulation first half receive sham first ) . Cognitive psychological assessment administer week rTMS therapy , active sham condition .
DOC.criteria: Adults present mild cognitive impairment ( trauma nontrauma relate ) History psychotic episode History neurological illness Active alcohol substance abuse History seizure disorder Currently pregnant
